Mapping the afterlife.
Probably the oldest map that we have of

Book of the Dead.
I'm going to show you an image now, a

The deceased enters the afterlife and has to

at the top

You'll see that the heart in this

That means that the deceased is not going to be

but will be escorted into the paradise

This description is very culturally laden,

I considered the hawk to be

They are describing

The very word psychedelic means mind

There were many encounters with

It seems pretty clear,
in Jung's writings, that he was able to

Planes of the afterlife and the realm

Something we might consider bordering on

I'm reminded of a

That is that every new spiritual realization

no doubt will be true regarding maps of

Nevertheless, maps are important. We have

Emanuel Swedenborg. He claimed to have

scholar pedagogic the study of education itself

He would consider
their descriptions regarding the nature

That's my understanding, although it may

a step in the direction of modernity
in the sense that he is applying
an academic discipline to our
knowledge of the afterlife. As a

I think it's a very important step

many more sophisticated
additions to our knowledge of the

died.
They were now communicating

psychical researchers or

What a unique
Event and and really one of the first I'm aware of

Immortality ostensibly dictated by the
deceased Frederick Myers, author of the

Survival of Bodily Death, while alive.
But dictated by him through the
automatic writing of Geraldine Cummins
in 1932, some three decades after his

put into human language the
extraordinary experiences that he himself,
as a soul, had been enjoying. Largely
enjoying the afterlife.
Now How can we improve upon
all of that work? How can we take it a

many questions that Myers left
unanswered and sometimes various

The Road to Immortality is taken quite

it was endorsed by
Sir Oliver Lodge the great physicist and

one of the greatest scientists
of his era. He was a spiritualist. He had
written about the survival of his own
son Raymond, he had been having extensive
communications with Raymond through the
great medium Gladys Osborne Leonard.
Communicating with Raymond, he
came to understand that Myers himself
was working with Raymond in the
afterlife. He was able to query Myers

immortality. Myers authenticated
through the mediumship of Mrs. Leonard that yes,
that was his legitimate effort to
communicate through Geraldine Cummins.
That he was largely satisfied with
the final product. As a result of that,
Sir Oliver Lodge wrote a forward to The
Road to Immortality, giving it a stamp of

channeled and mediumistic communications
about the afterlife. Even today,
90 years later, it stands as probably our
most sophisticated trustworthy map of
